description.narrative: National and provincial Governments have improved capacity to formulate policy and strategize, plan, budget, manage and coordinate multisectoral nutrition-specific and nutrition-sensitive interventions for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged children, adolescents and women, including during emergencies., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Emergency Programme Implementation

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and provincial Governments have improved capacity to formulate policy and strategize, plan, budget, manage and coordinate multisectoral nutrition-specific and nutrition-sensitive interventions for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged children, adolescents and women, including during emergencies.

description.narrative: A Multi-Sectoral National Nutrition Policy 2016–2026 was reviewed and a costed National Nutrition Strategic Action Plan (SAP) 2018-2022 launched with UNICEF's continuous technical and financial support. This has resulted in the operationalization of the action plan. Technical and financial support provided by UNICEF was the pivotal force for the development of the National Nutrition Policy and Strategic Action Plan (SAP). UNICEF is continuing its technical support in the implementation of the SAP and closely monitoring the implementation with the concerned government sectors through the Nutrition PMU (Project Management Unit). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of provinces with costed cross sectoral Nutrition Action plans
Number of provinces with budget allocation for nutrition
Costed multi-sectoral national nutrition Strategic Action Plan (SAP) 20182028 endorsed by the government
Existence of a pre-service training curriculum for community-based/integrated management of SAM for health and nutrition workers
Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions
